700504f-a.title: Bronx: Boston Road - 166th Street
700504f-a.text:
13 . PUDDING ROCK, formerly o Boston Road and 166th Street. A truly
immense glacial bowlder, rising 25 feot in the air, and being 30 feet-
in diameter. On one side was a natural fire-place, where tle Indians
used to enioy their corn feasts and oyster banquets. Under its cool
shade, the Huguenots rested on their lon Sabbath Day journeys from New
Rochelle down to the old French Protestant Church in lower New York.
After serving as a natural landmark to early settlers and to travelers
in stage coaches enroute from New York to Boston, it has finally been
blasted into countless fragments so as no longer to "obstruct the march
of civilization."

700503f-a.title: Bronx: Boston Road - 166th Street (East)
700503f-a.text:
Boston Road, at the N.E. corner of East 166th Street, showing the
Elton Mansion. On its site now (1937) stands Morris High School.
1901.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
